model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Neighbors B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Neighbors A: I just got back from my trip to South America. It was amazing!
Neighbors B: Oh really? Where did you go?
Neighbors A: I visited Brazil and Peru. The culture and food were incredible.
Neighbors B: That sounds awesome. I've always wanted to go to Peru to see Machu Picchu.
Neighbors A: Yes, Machu Picchu is amazing. The view from the top is breathtaking.

[MEMORY]
Neighbors A and B took a cooking class together last year, which led them to believe in doing nice things for others to bring the community together. This made Neighbors B agree that being organized could help them improve in their work and hobbies.

prediction:

Judgement: No
